content: - woodlouse crochet pattern - - pattern by woollendesigns woollendesigns 2023 notes for this pattern you can use any yarn you like going down two hook sizes from the chosen yarn recommendation i like to do it this way so that the stitches look neater/more compact it is also noted when you reach the legs but if you would like for your woodlouse to have shorter legs simply reduce the number of chains and keep the rest of the technique slip_stitch in spaces to next leg the same this pattern is written in us crochet terms as this is my first official pattern please allow for human error if you find any inconsistencies/mistakes please let me know and i ll do my best to fix it materials - chosen yarn i used two strands of a vintage 3ply yarn and 3mm hook as well as a super chunky yarn and 8mm hook for two different sized woodlice - crochet hook - stitch marker to mark beginning/end of row - yarn needle - scissors - safety eyes use whatever size you want your woodlouse to have - toy stuffing or you could use scrap yarn/yarn ends to stuff abbreviations single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain blo back loop only increase increase decrease decrease magic_ring magic_ring - number of stitches skip - skip sts - stitches woollendesigns 2023 now let s begin shell r1 chain 6 r2 ch1 turn single_crochet 5 5 r3 ch1 turn increase single_crochet 3 increase 7 r4 ch1 turn in blo increase single_crochet 5 increase 9 r5 ch1 turn increase single_crochet 7 increase 11 r6 ch1 turn in blo increase single_crochet 9 increase 13 r7 ch1 turn increase single_crochet 11 increase 15 r8-r23 ch1 turn alternate between single_crochet across in blo and single_crochet across r8 blo r9 across etc 15 r24 ch1 turn blo decrease single_crochet 11 decrease 13 r25 ch1 turn decrease single_crochet 9 decrease 11 r26 ch1 turn blo decrease single_crochet 7 decrease 9 r27 ch1 turn decrease single_crochet 5 decrease 7 r28 ch1 turn blo decrease single_crochet 3 decrease 5 r29 ch1 turn single_crochet in each stitch around the shell mark the first st you make so you know where to stop fasten_off insert safety eyes in the edge of the curve of the shell underside r1 ch10 r2 single_crochet across 9 r3-r17 like r8-r23 of the shell alternate between single_crochet across and single_crochet in blo between r3 and r17 of the underside r3 across r4 blo etc 9 woollendesigns 2023 r18 ch1 turn blo decrease single_crochet 5 decrease 7 r19 ch1 single_crochet across 7 r20 ch1 turn blo decrease single_crochet 3 decrease 5 fasten_off head r1 reattach yarn to start of the underside skip first 2 sts single_crochet 5 skip last 2 sts 5 r2 ch1 turn increase single_crochet 3 increase 7 r3 ch1 turn increase single_crochet 5 increase 9 r4 ch1 turn single_crochet across 9 r5 ch1 turn decrease single_crochet 5 decrease 7 r6 ch1 turn decrease single_crochet 3 decrease 5 fasten_off legs
